Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the idea that a Berkeley student pledged his entire college-savings fund to Bernie Sanders' campaign because education will be free when he's elected. The article is satirical and not based on real-life events.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that a Berkeley student actually pledged their college-savings fund to Bernie Sanders' campaign.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that education will be free if Bernie Sanders is elected, without providing any evidence or logical reasoning to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why a Berkeley student might donate their college-savings fund to Bernie Sanders' campaign, besides the assumption that education will be free.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that it is a satirical article from NPC Daily, which is known for its humorous and fictitious content.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the claim.
